marshal.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an officer of the highest rank in the army or air force of some countries
marshal.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the Marshal of the Royal Air Force
marshal.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an official in charge of an important public event or ceremony
marshal.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Heston has been named grand marshal of the parade.
marshal.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a person who controls crowds, traffic etc at a sports event or other public event
marshal.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I could see a marshal on the finish line waving a yellow flag.
marshal.translation[0].definitions[3].de: the officer in charge of a fire department
marshal.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to organize your thoughts, ideas etc so that they are clear, effective, or easy to understand
marshal.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: He paused for a moment as if to marshal his thoughts.
marshal.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to organize all the people or things that you need in order to be ready for a battle, election etc
marshal.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The general marshalled his forces for a major offensive.
Senator Bryant attempted to marshal support for the measure.
marshal.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to control or organize a large group
marshal.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The teacher marshalled the children into one group.
